title: Computational Thinking (CT) Skill Development Course Through Text-Based Programming

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic programming concepts (variables, conditionals, loops) and fundamental mathematical operations
context.additional_context: Systematic development of computational thinking (CT) skills through text-based programming activities for math problem-solving, providing flexible learning environments by combining online platforms with offline practice sessions

learning_goals: Students can design algorithms for solving math problems using the Python programming language.
Students can solve real-life problems by applying CT elements such as decomposition, abstraction, and automation.
Students can identify and correct logical errors in their programs through peer evaluation at least three times.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
